{{For2|the television talk show|[[Steve Harvey (TV series)]] and [[Steve (TV series)]]|the Jamaican activist|[[Murder of Lenford Harvey]]}} {{distinguish|Steve Harley}} {{Use mdy dates|date=September 2015}} {{Infobox person | name = Steve Harvey | image = SteveHarveyHWOFMay2013 (cropped).jpg | caption = Harvey at a ceremony receiving a star on the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]], May 13, 2013 | birth_name = Broderick Stephen Harvey | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1957|1|17}} | birth_place = [[Welch, West Virginia|Welch]], [[West Virginia]], U.S. | occupation = Comedian, radio host, television host, producer, radio personality, actor, author | years_active = 1985–present | spouse = {{unbulleted list|{{marriage|Marcia Harvey|1980|1994}}|{{marriage|Mary Shackelford|1996|2005}}|{{marriage|Marjorie Bridges|2007|}}}} | children = 7 (including 3 step-children)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://my.xfinity.com/slideshow/entertainment-dadsmostkids/12/|title=Steve Harvey -https://www.google.com/amp/s/people.com/tv/steve-harvey-and-marjorie-harvey-on-their-blended-family/amp/ – Hollywood Dads with the Most Kids – XFINITY|work=xfinity.com|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20151221045015/http://my.xfinity.com/slideshow/entertainment-dadsmostkids/12/|archivedate=December 21, 2015|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url = http://parade.com/340210/leahrozen/steve-harvey-on-success-and-his-hard-won-life-lessons-im-living-proof-you-can-reinvent-yourself/ | title = Steve Harvey on Success and His Hard-Won Life Lessons: "I'm Living Proof You Can Reinvent Yourself" | first = Leah | last = Rozen | date = October 3, 2014 | work = [[Parade (magazine)|Parade]] | publisher = Athlon Media Group | accessdate = October 23, 2015}}</ref> | website = {{url|steveharvey.com}} }}
'''Broderick Stephen Harvey'''<ref name="feud-20130204">{{Cite episode | series = Family Feud | series-link = Family Feud | network = [[Game Show Network|GSN]] | date = February 4, 2013 | minutes = 6 }} Also aired August 16, 2015.</ref><ref>{{Cite episode | series = Family Feud | series-link = Family Feud | network = [[Game Show Network|GSN]] | date = February 10, 2014 | minutes = 3 }} Aired March 12, 2017 on GSN.</ref> (born January 17, 1957) is an [[United States|American]] [[comedian]], television host, [[Television producer|producer]], [[radio personality]], actor and author. He hosts ''[[The Steve Harvey Morning Show]]'', the ''[[Steve (talk show)|Steve]]'' talk show, ''[[Family Feud]]'', ''[[Celebrity Family Feud]]'', ''[[Little Big Shots]]'' and its spinoff ''[[Little Big Shots: Forever Young]]'', ''[[Steve Harvey's Funderdome]]'', [[Showtime at the Apollo]] and since 2015, the [[Miss Universe]] pageant.
Harvey is the author of ''[[Act Like a Lady, Think Like a Man]]'', which was published in March 2009, and the book ''Straight Talk, No Chaser: How to Find and Keep a Man''. He starred in ''[[The Steve Harvey Show]]'', and was featured in ''[[The Original Kings of Comedy]]''. He is a six-time [[Daytime Emmy Award]] winner, two-time [[Marconi Award]] winner, and a 14-time [[NAACP Image Award]] winner in various categories.
==Early life== Harvey was born on January 17, 1957,<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/steve-harvey/175436/ | title=Steve Harvey |publisher=[[TV Guide|TVGuide.com]]| accessdate= December 21, 2015}}</ref><ref name="eonline.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/615660/steve-harvey-breaks-down-crying-during-birthday-surprise-this-is-the-greatest-moment-i-ve-ever-had|title=Steve Harvey Breaks Down Crying During Birthday Surprise: This Is the Greatest Moment I've Ever Had – E! Online|date=January 16, 2015|work=E! Online}}</ref> in [[Welch, West Virginia|Welch]], [[West Virginia]] and is the son of Jesse Harvey, a coal miner, and his wife Eloise Vera.<ref name="beverlyhillscourierstar">[http://bhcourier.com/family-feud-host-steve-harvey-hollywood-walk-fame-star/2013/05/13 ‘Family Feud’ Host Steve Harvey to Get Hollywood Walk of Fame Star] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131109194654/http://bhcourier.com/family-feud-host-steve-harvey-hollywood-walk-fame-star/2013/05/13 |date=November 9, 2013}}, ''[[The Beverly Hills Courier]]'', May 13, 2013</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.filmreference.com/film/15/Steve-Harvey.html|title=Steve Harvey Biography|accessdate=March 25, 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://parade.com/340210/leahrozen/steve-harvey-on-success-and-his-hard-won-life-lessons-im-living-proof-you-can-reinvent-yourself|title=Steve Harvey on Success and His Hard-Won Life Lessons: 'I'm Living Proof You Can Reinvent Yourself'|first=Leah|last=Rozen|publisher=}}</ref> His first name is Broderick, named after actor [[Broderick Crawford]] of the TV series ''[[Highway Patrol (U.S. TV series)|Highway Patrol]]''.<ref name="feud-20130204"/> Harvey's family moved to [[Cleveland]], [[Ohio]], living on East 112th Street, which would eventually be renamed Steve Harvey Way in 2015. He graduated from [[Glenville High School]] in 1974.<ref name = "Harvey Way"/><ref name="yahoobio">[https://movies.yahoo.com/movie/contributor/1800424044/bio Yahoo] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071217203714/http://movies.yahoo.com/movie/contributor/1800424044/bio|date=December 17, 2007}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|first=Mark|last=Dawidziak|title=Steve Harvey joins ''GMA''|url=http://www.cleveland.com/tv/index.ssf/2009/08/steve_harvey_joins_good_mornin.html|work=[[The Plain Dealer]]|date=August 17, 2009|accessdate=August 18, 2009}}</ref>
Shortly after high school, he attended [[Kent State University]] and [[West Virginia University]] and is a member of [[Omega Psi Phi]] fraternity.<ref name="beverlyhillscourierstar"/><ref name="yahoobio"/> He has been a boxer, an autoworker, an insurance salesman, a carpet cleaner and a mailman.<ref name="beverlyhillscourierstar"/><ref name="yahoobio"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/tv/ci_15560802|title=15 Minutes with Steve Harvey|first=Jessica|last=Yadegaran|work=Contra Costa Times|date=July 20, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.liveleak.com/view?i=bf4_1358580122|title=Steve Harvey has emotional reunion|date=January 9, 2013}}</ref>
==Career== ===Comedy=== Harvey first performed [[stand-up comedy]] on October 8, 1985, at the Hilarities Comedy Club in Cleveland, Ohio. In the late 1980s Harvey was [[homelessness|homeless]] for multiple years. He slept in his 1976 [[Ford]] when not performing gigs that provided a hotel, and he showered at gas stations or swimming pool showers.<ref>{{cite web|title=Steve Harvey: I Was Homeless for Three Years|author=Triggs, Charlotte|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20741192,00.html|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=October 3, 2013|accessdate=September 21, 2014}}</ref> Rich and Becky Liss helped Harvey during this time with a contract for carpet cleaning and credit at a travel agency.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2013-01-23/entertainment/os-steve-harvey-sheds-tears-over-orlando-supporters-20130123_1_steve-harvey-travel-agency-tears|title=Steve Harvey sheds tears over generous Orlando supporters|work=Orlando Sentinel|date=January 23, 2013|accessdate=September 27, 2014|author=Boedeker, Hal|archivedate=September 27, 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140927180452/http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2013-01-23/entertainment/os-steve-harvey-sheds-tears-over-orlando-supporters-20130123_1_steve-harvey-travel-agency-tears}}</ref>
He was a finalist in the Second Annual [[Johnnie Walker]] National Comedy Search performing on April 16, 1990, eventually leading to a long stint as host of ''[[It's Showtime at the Apollo]]'', succeeding [[Mark Curry (actor)|Mark Curry]] in that role. His success as a [[stand-up comedy|stand-up comedian]] led to a starring role on the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] show ''[[Me and the Boys (TV series)|Me and the Boys]]'' in 1994. He would later star on the [[The Warner Brothers|WB]] network show, ''[[The Steve Harvey Show]]'', which ran from 1996 to 2002. While popular, the show never achieved critical acclaim outside of the African-American community.<ref>{{cite web|title=Steve Harvey- Biography|url=https://movies.yahoo.com/person/steve-harvey/biography.html|publisher=[[Yahoo! Movies]]|accessdate=June 24, 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130303145753/http://movies.yahoo.com/person/steve-harvey/biography.html|archivedate=March 3, 2013}}</ref> [[File:Steve Harvey September 2008.jpg|left|thumb|Harvey in September 2008]] In 1997, Harvey continued his work in stand-up comedy, performing on the Kings of Comedy tour along with [[Cedric the Entertainer]], [[D.L. Hughley]], and [[Bernie Mac]]. The comedy act would later be put together into a film by [[Spike Lee]] called ''[[The Original Kings of Comedy]]''. DVD sales of ''The Original Kings of Comedy'' and ''Don't Trip, He Ain't Through With Me Yet'' increased Harvey's popularity. He released a [[Hip hop music|hip hop]] and [[R&B]] CD on a [[record label]] he founded, and authored the book ''Steve Harvey's Big Time''. That title was also used as the name of his comedy and variety television show (later renamed ''[[Steve Harvey's Big Time Challenge]]''), which aired on [[The WB]] network from 2003 until 2005. Harvey launched a clothing line which featured a line of dress wear. In 2005 he co-starred in the movie ''[[Racing Stripes]]''. He had appeared in the 2003 movie ''[[The Fighting Temptations]]'' alongside [[Cuba Gooding Jr.]] and [[Beyoncé Knowles]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Brown|first=Scott|title=The Fighting Temptations|url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,487592,00.html|accessdate=June 24, 2013|newspaper=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=September 18, 2003}}</ref>
He achieved further critical and commercial success through his book ''[[Act Like a Lady, Think Like a Man]]'' and its subsequent cinematic follow-up ''[[Think Like a Man]]'', an ensemble romantic comedy depicting characters taking advice on dating from the book.<ref>{{cite news|last=Saltz|first=Rachel|title=‘Think Like a Man’ Brings Steve Harvey’s Book to Life|url=https://movies.nytimes.com/2012/04/20/movies/think-like-a-man-brings-steve-harveys-book-to-life.html|accessdate=June 24, 2013|newspaper=[[New York Times]]|date=April 19, 2012}}</ref>
In 2008, Harvey hosted the Disney Dreamers Academy, a teen-focused personal and professional enrichment event that took place January 17–20, 2008, at the [[Walt Disney World Resort]] in [[Lake Buena Vista, Florida]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.disneydreamersacademy.com/?int_cmp=SOC-intDPFY12Q1DisneyDreamersAcademy31-01-12@0002|title=with Steve Harvey|publisher=Disneydreamersacademy.com|accessdate=June 10, 2015}}</ref>
On August 2, 2012, Harvey performed his final stand-up act at the [[MGM Grand Las Vegas|MGM Grand]] in [[Las Vegas Valley|Las Vegas]], ending a 27-year career as a stand-up comedian. The two-hour performance was broadcast live on [[Pay-Per-View]]. “The road to this final show has been an amazing journey, doing stand-up for the past 27 years, and I can’t thank fans enough after reflecting on all those years on stage,” he said.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/08/01/steve-harvey-grand-stand-up-finale_n_1730387.html|title=Steve Harvey Grand Stand-Up Finale: Comedian Calls It Quits With Last Show In Las Vegas|publisher=Huffingtonpost.com|date=August 1, 2012|accessdate=June 10, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://blogs.indiewire.com/shadowandact/watch-steve-harveys-tearful-goodbye-to-stand-up-at-his-final-show|title=Watch: Steve Harvey's Tearful Goodbye To Stand-Up At His | Shadow and Act|publisher=Blogs.indiewire.com|accessdate=June 10, 2015}}</ref>
===Radio=== {{Main article|The Steve Harvey Morning Show}} [[File:Steve Harvey, April 6, 2010.jpg|thumb|Harvey hosting his syndicated radio show in 2010]] Harvey is the host of a weekday-morning radio program, ''The Steve Harvey Morning Show'', which was originally syndicated through [[Radio One, Inc.]] (from September 2000 until May 2005) and which continues to air to the present time.
===''Family Feud''=== Harvey began hosting ''[[Family Feud]]'' in September 2010.<ref name="beverlyhillscourierstar"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.broadcastingcable.com/article/445187-Steve_Harvey_to_Host_Family_Feud_.php?rssid=20068|title=Steve Harvey to host ''Family Feud''|last=Albiniak|first=Paige|date=January 21, 2010|work=Broadcasting & Cable|accessdate=January 22, 2010}}</ref> The show has seen significantly improved ratings under Harvey. As of November 2012, it was the second most watched daytime syndicated show.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.broadcastingcable.com/article/490300-Looking_to_Reach_Women_in_Daytime_TV_Syndication_Is_a_Solid_Alternative.php|title=Looking to Reach Women in Daytime TV? Syndication Is a Solid Alternative|publisher=Broadcastingcable.com|accessdate=February 28, 2013}}</ref>
Harvey also hosts ''[[Celebrity Family Feud]]'', where celebrities compete for a chance to donate up to $25,000 to their favorite charity. The show airs during the summer on [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://abc.go.com/shows/celebrity-family-feud/news/updates/celebrity-contestants-announced-for-celebrity-family-feud-06052015 |title=Celebrity Contestants Announced for "Celebrity Family Feud" |work=ABC press release |last=Dove |first=Steve |date=June 5, 2015 |accessdate=June 13, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title='Celebrity Family Feud' to Premiere Sunday June 21, on ABC With Episode Featuring Anthony Anderson & Toni Braxton|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2015/06/11/celebrity-family-feud-to-premiere-sunday-june-21-on-abc-with-episode-featuring-Anthony-Anderson-toni-Braxton/416127/|website=tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com|accessdate=June 11, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Vernon Davis Is Terrible at Family Feud, Which It Turns Out, Is Also Awful|url=http://awfulannouncing.com/2015/vernon-davis-is-terrible-at-family-feud-which-it-turns-out-is-also-terrible.html |website=awfulannoucing.com |accessdate=June 29, 2015}}</ref>
===Daytime talk shows=== {{main|Steve Harvey (TV series)}} In September 2012, Harvey debuted a self-titled [[broadcast syndication|syndicated]] talk show, produced by [[Endemol Shine North America|Endemol]] and distributed by [[NBCUniversal Television Distribution]], at the [[NBC Tower]] in [[Chicago]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.suntimes.com/11240060-460/new-steve-harvey-tv-show-coming-to-chicago-studio.html|title=New ‘Steve Harvey’ TV show coming to Chicago studio|work=[[Chicago Sun-Times]]|publisher=[[Sun-Times Media Group]] ([[Wrapports LLC]])|date=March 12, 2012|accessdate=September 18, 2015}}</ref><ref>Thomas-Bailey, Carlene. ''G2: Shortcuts: Television: Steve Harvey — he's the new Oprah Winfrey'', [[The Guardian]], April 15, 2013</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|title=NBCUniversal Domestic TV Distribution’s ‘Steve Harvey’ Renewed For Second Season|url=http://www.deadline.com/2013/01/nbcuniversal-domestic-tv-distributions-steve-harvey-renewed-for-second-season|publisher=Deadline Hollywood|accessdate=September 18, 2015|date=January 10, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Goldberg|first=Lesley|title='Steve Harvey' Syndicated Talk Show Renewed for Second Season|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/steve-harvey-syndicated-talk-show-410763|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]]|accessdate=September 18, 2015|date=January 10, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2013/01/10/steve-harvey-renewed-for-second-season-in-national-syndication-380502/20130110nbc01/|title="Steve Harvey" Renewed for Second Season in National Syndication|work=[[The Futon Critic]]|publisher=Futon Media|accessdate=September 18, 2015}}</ref> The show was renewed through 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2013/06/12/steve-harvey-sold-through-2016-to-nbc-owned-television-stations/187052/|title='Steve Harvey' Sold Through 2016 to NBC Owned Television Stations|last=Bibel|first=Sara|work=[[TV by the Numbers]]|publisher=[[Tribune Media|Tribune Digital Ventures]]|date=June 12, 2013|accessdate=September 18, 2015}}</ref>
In November 2016, ''Steve Harvey'' was cancelled, and it was announced that Harvey had reached a deal with [[IMG (company)|IMG]] to produce a new syndicated talk show in Los Angeles with NBCUniversal. The new series, ''[[Steve (TV series)|Steve]]'', premiered in September 2017, and was described as having more of a celebrity- and comedy-oriented format with a larger amount of creative control held by Harvey, as opposed to the previous program's larger focus on [[human interest]] subjects. To facilitate the new series, production of Harvey's radio show and ''Family Feud'' were re-located to LA as well.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Andreeva|first1=Nellie|title=Steve Harvey To End Daytime Talk Show, Launch New One With IMG & NBCU|url=http://deadline.com/2016/11/steve-harvey-daytime-talk-show-end-new-show-img-nbcu-1201852895/|website=Deadline|accessdate=11 November 2016}}</ref><ref name="philly-newsteve">{{cite news|url=http://www.phillytrib.com/entertainment/television/steve-harvey-returns-to-daytime-with-new-look-new-vibe/article_7b588b7d-0988-55ee-bcb9-d0c9981d578b.html|title=Steve Harvey returns to daytime with new look, new vibe|last=Roberts|first=Kimberly C.|work=[[Philadelphia Tribune]]|publisher=[[Tronc]]|location=[[Philadelphia]]|issn=0746-956X|accessdate=September 6, 2017|language=en}}</ref>
===Dating website=== In September 2014, Harvey launched a new dating website called ''Delightful'' to "help Women become more dateable".<ref>[https://www.forbes.com/sites/jeffbercovici/2014/10/09/steve-harvey-launches-delightful-help-women/ Steve Harvey Launches A Site To Help Women 'Become More Dateable'], Forbes.com, September 10, 2014</ref>
===Miss Universe pageant=== In December 2015, Harvey hosted the [[Miss Universe 2015]] pageant in [[Las Vegas]]. Upon announcing the final results, he mistakenly named the first runner-up, [[Miss Colombia]], [[Ariadna Gutiérrez]], as the winner. A few minutes after she was crowned, Harvey announced that he had read the results incorrectly and that [[Binibining Pilipinas|Miss Philippines]], [[Pia Wurtzbach]], was the new Miss Universe.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://money.cnn.com/2015/12/20/media/miss-universe-steve-harvey-mistake/index.html|title=Steve Harvey mistakenly crowns the wrong Miss Universe 2015|last=Stelter|first=Brian|date=December 21, 2015|publisher=[[CNNMoney]]|accessdate=December 21, 2015}}</ref> He apologized to Wurtzbach outside the venue and later [[Twitter|tweeted]] an apology to both contestants.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Hegina|first1=Aries Joseph|title=Steve Harvey apologizes for Miss Universe mix-up; misspells PH, Colombia|url=http://lifestyle.inquirer.net/217010/steve-harvey-apologizes-for-miss-universe-mix-up-misspells-ph-colombia|accessdate=December 21, 2015|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=December 21, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=WATCH: Host says sorry to Pia Wurtzbach over mix-up|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/lifestyle/12/21/15/watch-host-says-sorry-to-pia-wurtzbach-over-mix-up|accessdate=December 21, 2015|work=[[ABS-CBNnews.com]]|publisher=[[ABS-CBN Corporation]]|date=December 21, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title=Host Steve Harvey Botches Miss Universe Announcement|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/pop-culture-news/host-steve-harvey-botches-miss-universe-announcement-n483586|date=Dec 21, 2015|publisher=NBC News|accessdate=December 21, 2015}}</ref>
Harvey also hosted the [[Miss Universe 2016]] pageant in the Philippines on January 30, 2017, telling the [[Miss Universe Organization]] that he wanted to personally apologize to the Filipinos for the incident that occurred in the last Miss Universe pageant he hosted.<ref>{{cite news|title=Steve Harvey will host Miss Universe in PH|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/life/07/29/16/steve-harvey-will-host-miss-universe-in-ph|accessdate=July 30, 2016|work=[[ABS-CBN News]]|date=July 29, 2016}}</ref>
He returned as host for the [[Miss Universe 2017]] pageant in Las Vegas on November 26, 2017.
Harvey is set to host the Miss Universe 2018 pageant in Thailand on December 16, 2018. <ref>{{Cite news|url=https://deadline.com/2018/07/miss-universe-pageant-2018-date-location-steve-harvey-returning-as-host-1202436544/|title=Miss Universe 2018 Heads To Thailand With Steve Harvey Returning As Host|last=Petski|first=Denise|date=2018-07-31|work=Deadline|access-date=2018-07-31|language=en-US}}</ref>
=== Variety specials === In October 2016, it was announced that Harvey would host two revival specials of ''[[Showtime at the Apollo]]'' for Fox.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://variety.com/2016/tv/news/steve-harvey-to-host-showtime-at-the-apollo-revival-on-fox-1201886943|title=Steve Harvey to Host ‘Showtime at the Apollo’ Revival on Fox|last=Holloway|first=Daniel|date=2016-10-12|work=Variety|access-date=2017-11-24|language=en-US}}</ref> Fox later announced that Harvey would host the network's [[New Year's Eve]] special from [[Times Square Ball|Times Square]] for 2018. As with his talk show, it will be produced by IMG.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/fox-swaps-pitbull-steve-harvey-new-years-eve-1059096|title=Fox Swaps Pitbull for Steve Harvey on New Year's Eve|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=2017-11-18|language=en}}</ref>
==Controversies== ===Political commentary=== In August 2011, on his radio show, Harvey called [[Cornel West]] and [[Tavis Smiley]], "[[Uncle Tom]]s", because of their criticism of President [[Barack Obama]].<ref>[http://thegrio.com/2011/08/10/steve-harvey-cornel-west-tavis-smiley-are-uncle-toms/#13768994090191&386px Steve Harvey: Cornel West, Tavis Smiley are 'Uncle Toms'] Deron Dalton. the Grio.com. August 10, 2011. Retrieved August 19, 2013</ref> Harvey later apologized for using the slur but maintained his criticism of West and Smiley.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/post-partisan/post/smiley-allergic-to-my-poverty-tour-reaction/2011/03/04/gIQAziPwJJ_blog.html|title=Smiley 'allergic' to my poverty tour reaction|first=Jonathan|last=Capehart|publisher=The Washnington Post|date=2011-08-16|accessdate=2017-11-05}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.greanvillepost.com/2014/05/26/where-does-steve-harvey-get-off-calling-tavis-smiley-and-cornel-west-uncle-toms/|title=Where does Steve Harvey get off calling Travis Smiley and Cornel West "Uncle Toms"?|publisher=The Greanville Post|date=2014-05-26|accessdate=2017-11-05}}</ref> In January 2017, Harvey was met with backlash from some in the African-American community for his decision to meet with then-[[President-elect of the United States|President-elect]] [[Donald Trump]]. He defended his decision, citing that it would help spark positive changes,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.essence.com/celebrity/steve-harvey-wont-attend-2017-inauguration|title=Steve Harvey: 'I Won't Be At Anybody's Inauguration Because My Wife Said No'|date=January 15, 2017|first=Rachaell|last=Davis|work=Essence|edition=online|publisher=[[Time Inc.]]|accessdate=May 21, 2017}}</ref> but then later admitted on [[Steve (talk show)|his talk show]] that he hopes to never run into Trump again.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6pYDiaCiLbk|title=Our biggest secrets are coming out! Dylan McDermott and Steve play 'Putt & Tell'}}</ref>
===Comments about atheists=== Harvey has received criticism for a May 30, 2009 book interview he gave on ''[[Larry King Live]]'' guest hosted by [[Joy Behar]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/video/#/video/showbiz/2009/05/29/lkl.steve.harvey.cnn?iref=allsearch|title=Steve Harvey on relationships|first=Joy|last=Behar|publisher=CNN|date=30 May 2009|accessdate=15 March 2011}}</ref> During that interview, he asserted that women should not date atheists who, he claimed, have no "moral barometer." He opined that atheists are "idiot[s]" and stated that his usual response to discussions with atheists is to walk away.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.cnsnews.com/blog/michael-w-chapman/steve-harvey-atheists-me-you-re-idiot|title=Steve Harvey on Atheists: 'To Me, You're An Idiot'|first=Michael|last=Chapman|publisher=CNS News|date=2015-01-06|accessdate=2017-11-05}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/opinion/attacks-atheists-continue-article-1.3109420|title=The attacks on atheists continue: Gov. John Kasich insults nonbelievers, and, par for the course, almost nobody notices|first=Ross|last=Rosenfeld|publisher=NY Daily News|date=2017-04-27|accessdate=2017-11-05}}</ref>
===Comments about Asian men=== In January 2017, Steve Harvey made jokes on ''Steve Harvey'' about Asian men, ridiculing the idea that any white woman or black woman would want to date them. "Excuse me, do you like Asian men?", he said, "No, thank you." He went on to add, "I don’t even like Chinese food."<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv/steve-harvey-fire-making-jokes-asian-men-article-1.2944619|title=Steve Harvey under fire for making jokes about Asian men|newspaper=NY Daily News|access-date=2017-01-16}}</ref> The remarks were met with criticism from members of the [[Asian American]] community, including [[New York (state)|New York]] politicians and author [[Eddie Huang]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/new-york/steve-harvey-hot-water-asian-american-n-y-lawmakers-article-1.2946405|title=Steve Harvey in hot water with Asian-American New York lawmakers|first=Rich|last=Schapiro|publisher=NY Daily News|date=2017-01-14|accessdate=2017-11-05}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.vulture.com/2017/01/eddie-huang-on-steve-harveys-jokes-on-asian-men.html|title=Eddie Huang on Steve Harvey’s ‘Hypocritical’ and ‘Upsetting’ Willingness to Emasculate Asian Men for Laughs|date=2017-01-15|newspaper=Vulture|access-date=2017-01-16}}</ref> Harvey apologized on his talk show and Twitter, saying: "I offer my humblest apology for offending anyone, particularly those in the Asian community. ... "It was not my intention and the humor was not meant with any malice or disrespect whatsoever."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.etonline.com/tv/207704_steve_harvey_apologizes_for_asian_men_remarks/|title=Steve Harvey Apologizes for Racist Asian Jokes: 'Not Meant With Any Malice or Disrespect'|first=Alex|last=Ungerman|publisher=ET|date=2017-01-17|accessdate=2017-11-05}}</ref>
===Comments about Flint water crisis=== In response to a caller from [[Flint, Michigan]] who insulted the Cleveland Cavaliers after their loss to the Golden State Warriors, Harvey, a Cavaliers fan, told the caller to "go have yourself a nice glass of brown water!" in reference to the [[Flint water crisis|city's water crisis]]. The joke was criticized by, among others, [[List of presidential trips made by Barack Obama during 2016#May|Amariyanna Copeny]] and Flint Mayor [[Karen Weaver]], who demanded a public apology. Harvey responded by saying, "The caller and I were talking trash about our teams and cities. Simply trash talking about sports. I made a joke directed at him, as he is from Flint, a city for which I have great affection and respect. So much so that I devoted a full hour on my daytime talk show to raising awareness for the Flint water crisis. ... The caller laughed, as my joke was taken in the context it was offered."<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.metrotimes.com/the-scene/archives/2017/06/14/did-steve-harvey-really-tell-a-flint-resident-to-enjoy-your-nice-brown-glass-of-water|title=Did Steve Harvey really tell a Flint resident to 'enjoy your nice brown glass of water?'|last=Roskopp|first=Jack|date=June 14, 2017|accessdate=June 17, 2017|newspaper=[[Metro Times]]|location=[[Ferndale, Michigan]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fox2detroit.com/news/local-news/261782302-story|publisher=WJBK|title='Little Miss Flint,' Mayor Karen Weaver blast Steve Harvey after water joke|date=June 15, 2017|accessdate=August 2, 2017}}</ref>
==Personal life== Harvey has been married three times and has seven children (4 biological and 3 stepchildren). From his first marriage, to Marcia Harvey, he has two daughters (twins Brandi and Karli) and one son (Broderick Harvey Jr).<ref>Emily Strohm and Brittany King, [http://people.com/tv/steve-harvey-on-leaving-first-wife-and-family-to-chase-his-dream/ People Magazine: "Steve Harvey on Finding Forgiveness from His Daughters After Leaving Them to Chase His Dream of Becoming a Comedian"], people.com, May 25, 2016</ref><ref name="yahoobio"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://blackcelebkids.com/2008/05/17/steve-harvey-loves-his-blended-family|title=Harvey in June 2008 Essence Mag Father's Day article|archivedate=October 14, 2013|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131014001900/http://www.blackcelebkids.com/2008/05/17/steve-harvey-loves-his-blended-family/}}</ref> From his second marriage, to Mary Shackelford, Harvey has another son named Wynton.<ref>[http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/gossip/2011/01/steve-harvey-ex-wife-mary-harvey.html Los Angeles Times: "Steve Harvey's ex-wife speaks out on marriage, infidelity"] January 24, 2011</ref><ref>[http://www.steveharveytv.com/celebrate-my-drive] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131009032229/http://www.steveharveytv.com/celebrate-my-drive|date=October 9, 2013}}</ref> The couple divorced in November 2005.<ref>[http://www.perfectpeople.net/biography/8562/steve-harvey.htm] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090228184907/http://www.perfectpeople.net/biography/8562/steve-harvey.htm|date=February 28, 2009}}</ref>
In 2011, [[Collin County, Texas]]-based 199th District Court Judge Robert Dry expressed concern about Mary Harvey spreading false information about the divorce, with the judge suggesting that she had not been left materially destitute.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/steve-harvey-ex-wife-mary-harvey-slammed-judge-making-false-allegations-comedian-article-1.135268|title=Steve Harvey's ex slammed by judge for making false allegations|publisher=Nydailynews.com|date=February 8, 2011|accessdate=June 10, 2015|location=New York}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Steve Harvey's Ex-Wife Blasts Him For Cheating|work=[[The Huffington Post]]|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/01/24/steve-harveys-exwife-blas_n_813096.html|date=April 2011|accessdate=October 5, 2013}}</ref>
In June 2007, he married Marjorie Bridges, who he says is responsible for making him a better man and changing his life. Marjorie Harvey is mother to three children (Morgan, Jason and Lori). Steve raises them as his own. Steve and Marjorie have four grandchildren: two through Jason's marriage to his wife Amanda, one through Morgan's marriage to her husband Kareem and one through Karli's marriage to husband Ben.<ref>Karu F. Daniels,[http://www.bvnewswire.com/2009/11/06/steve-harvey-wife-marjorie-essence-interview/ His New Wife is the Woman Who Changed His Life] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151109072409/http://www.bvnewswire.com/2009/11/06/steve-harvey-wife-marjorie-essence-interview |date=November 9, 2015 }}, bvnewswire.com, November 6, 2009.</ref>
Harvey and his family divide their time between [[Atlanta, Georgia|Atlanta]], where his radio show is broadcast and ''Family Feud'' is recorded, and Chicago, where he hosts his talk show for [[NBCUniversal]] from the company's [[NBC Tower|Chicago studios]], although he will host his radio show there as well.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.chicagotribune.com/2012-03-12/entertainment/chi-steve-harvey-show-100-jobs-coming-to-chicago-20120312_1_tax-credits-radio-show-endemol-usa |title=Steve Harvey hitting town with new show|publisher=Articles.chicagotribune.com|date=March 12, 2012|accessdate=June 10, 2015}}</ref>
Harvey is a [[Christian]].<ref>{{Cite news|title = Steve Harvey Credits God for Career During Emotional Final Comedy Show|date = August 6, 2012|url = http://www.christianpost.com/news/steve-harvey-credits-god-for-career-during-emotional-final-comedy-show-79555/|first = Christine|last = Thomasos|accessdate = July 22, 2013|work = [[The Christian Post]]}}</ref>
